Posted By: jhjohns (7/11/2009 3:16:14 AM)

posts.post_content:
I recently got my hands on one of these guys and I feel like out of all the planeswalkers this guy is one of the planeswalkers that gets ignored the most (not a bad thing).
  
   
For 4 mana you really are geting a pretty good deal, you can pump him to gain life and set your self up for his final, but this only works if you have a strong defence, and often the avatar won't be able to break through the lines.
  
   
I feel were the most power lies is with his seconed ability. You can use him to continusly boost all your creatures (great for white weenie decks) and make it so you can attack without worrying about leaving creatures as blockers. A very powerfull ability that is all to often overlooked.
  
   
Ajani Goldmane is an intresting planeswalker and one of my personal favorites. While many people consider him weak since he does not have an ability that ends the game when it goes off, what makes him great is that he has an ability that sets you up to win that can be used the moment he hits the... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

I feel were the most power lies is with his seconed ability. You can use him to continusly boost all your creatures (great for white weenie decks) and make it so you can attack without worrying about leaving creatures as blockers. A very powerfull ability that is all to often overlooked.

posts.post_content:
so what you do, once you pump out the avatar, lets say it is a 5/5 (5 life) pay 2, equip shield of the ritgeous, pay 3 more, equip behemoth sledge, now it is a 7/9 trample, lifelink, vigilant that keeps what ever it blocks tapped, block, and it is now a 14/16 and you are at 12, swing, play rafiq, swing with the 15/17 FS, damage, it is a 30/32 and you are at 27, normal combat, damage, 60/62 and you are at 57, it goes down to a 59/61 without the exalted boost on their turn, block again, 116 life and it is a 118/120, your turn, finest hour, by the time it is over, you are at 1900 and your token is at 1902/1904  
  
of course, that is assuming your opponent survived the first strike when you were at 12 life, you know, the turn before ^\_^  
  
now, that is a little tricky to pull off, I will admit it, but it is doable, and ajani's last ability is great for a mono white fog+lifegain deck, I dont think Ajani is the best planeswalker, but he is up there, and great in an agro deck due to his second abi... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

of course, that is assuming your opponent survived the first strike when you were at 12 life, you know, the turn before ^_^

now, that is a little tricky to pull off, I will admit it, but it is doable, and ajani's last ability is great for a mono white fog+lifegain deck, I dont think Ajani is the best planeswalker, but he is up there, and great in an agro deck due to his second abi... (see all)

posts.post_content:
While planeswalkers are ([almost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=190411)) always good with [doubling season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doubling season), this is very good.  
  
It comes in with 8 counters, activates its ultimate, which gives you 2 enormous avatars. This has won me many edh games. (In my [Rhys the Redeemed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rhys the Redeemed) deck.)
posts.html:

Posted By: mpawliuk (7/2/2012 6:03:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
His ultimate is pretty mediocre. It has no trample or flying or haste or anything, which means it gets chump blocked all day, and if you're at low life it's useless. Yeah, you could use a kicked rite of replication, but a kicked rite of replication with ANYTHING is pretty much gg.  
  
His +1 is crap, which makes it even harder to build to his ultimate because he's sitting around doing effectively nothing for several turns until he gets 6 loyalty. lol2 life.  
  
However, his -1 is amazing, and whenever I play him, it's the only ability I use. It's a great way to pump your guys AND keep you safe. Don't underestimate vigilance. Or permanent +1/+1. It can even work with persist to get rid of -1/-1 counters. The only problem is keeping track of how many +1/+1 counters each of my creatures have.
posts.html:
His ultimate is pretty mediocre. It has no trample or flying or haste or anything, which means it gets chump blocked all day, and if you're at low life it's useless. Yeah, you could use a kicked rite of replication, but a kicked rite of replication with ANYTHING is pretty much gg.

His +1 is crap, which makes it even harder to build to his ultimate because he's sitting around doing effectively nothing for several turns until he gets 6 loyalty. lol2 life.

However, his -1 is amazing, and whenever I play him, it's the only ability I use. It's a great way to pump your guys AND keep you safe. Don't underestimate vigilance. Or permanent +1/+1. It can even work with persist to get rid of -1/-1 counters. The only problem is keeping track of how many +1/+1 counters each of my creatures have.
